text: If someone interested, and if you can suggest a better implementation, I added thes lines to check if the active window is the one of the game, so the program runs only when the game windows is active. First import this "from win32gui import GetWindowText, GetForegroundWindow" and then I put this check inside the while loop "if GetWindowText(GetForegroundWindow())== "your window name here":" I'm sure theres a better way to do this, but this works

author: @omarkhayyamravenhurst3982
text: You're re-allocating the mask zeros array every time you call roi(..). It should be much faster if you allocate it once (outside the function) and then just clear it using mask[: ,:] = 0 (and then you do the fillPoly etc)  Come to think of it, if your roi stays the same you only need to calc mask once

author: @etopowertwon
text: Wouldn't it be better to create mask only once and reuse it?  Right now we fill mask polygon every frame  from  the vertices, which is probably not healthy for CPU cycles.

author: @pottingmix3733
text: If you use windows api to capture the window it wont get messed up by another window in front of it.  def imageCapture(handle):     left, top, right, bot = win32gui.GetWindowRect(handle)     w = right - left     h = bot - top     hwndDC = win32gui.GetWindowDC(handle)     mfcDC  = win32ui.CreateDCFromHandle(hwndDC)     saveDC = mfcDC.CreateCompatibleDC()     saveBitMap = win32ui.CreateBitmap()     saveBitMap.CreateCompatibleBitmap(mfcDC, w, h)     saveDC.SelectObject(saveBitMap)     PW_RENDERFULLCONTENT = 2     result = windll.user32.PrintWindow(handle, saveDC.GetSafeHdc(), PW_RENDERFULLCONTENT)     bmpinfo = saveBitMap.GetInfo()     bmpstr = saveBitMap.GetBitmapBits(True)     im = Image.frombuffer(         'RGB',         (bmpinfo['bmWidth'], bmpinfo['bmHeight']),         bmpstr, 'raw', 'BGRX', 0, 1)     win32gui.DeleteObject(saveBitMap.GetHandle())     saveDC.DeleteDC()     mfcDC.DeleteDC()     win32gui.ReleaseDC(handle, hwndDC)     if result == 1:         im.save("image.png") The PW_RENDERFULLCONTENT flag was added in windows 8 or newer OS so it might not work on windows 7. The flag makes it possible to capture some windows that display using  DirectX through DWM.

author: @ashketchum7768
text: Instead of importing pyautogui for correct display of image, try the following lines at imshow:  window_name = "MyScreen" cv2.namedWindow( window_name, cv2.WINDOW_AUTOSIZE ) cv2.imshow( window_name, new_screen )  EDIT: first two lines should only be run once - so put them outside loop and put cv2.imshow line in the loop

author: @windmill1965
text: In process_img you first process the entire image and then you throw away the part you're not interested in. Wouldn't it be more efficient if you first throw away the part you're not interested in before processing the image? That might save some computing effort needed?
